column1: When Cedric the Saxon saw his son drop down senseless in the great tournament at Ashby
column2: his first impulse was to order him into the care of his own attendants
column3: but the words choked in his throat. He could not bring himself to acknowledge
column4: in the presence of such an assembly
column5: the son whom he had renounced and disinherited for his allegiance to the Norman king of England
column6: Richard of the Lion Heart. However
column7: he ordered one of the officers of his household
column9: to convey Ivanhoe to Ashby as soon as the crowd had dispersed. But the man was anticipated in this good office. The crowd dispersed
column11: but the wounded knight was nowhere to be seen.It seemed as if the fairies had conveyed Ivanhoe from the spot; and Cedric's officer might have adopted some such theory to account for his disappearance
column12: had he not suddenly cast his eyes on a person attired like a squire
column13: in whom he recognized the features of his fellow-servant Gurth
column14: who had run away from his master.
